---

## SDQ vs SF-36

Conducting cross-instrument comparisons and harmonisations can be a complex process for researchers. Considering two distinct, yet slightly similar instruments like the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Short Form Health Survey (36-item) (SF-36) highlights this complexity. These two key instruments play a crucial role in the field of psychology and social science, but comparing SDQ and SF-36 can be a daunting task, considering their different scopes. This is where Harmony, an AI-powered software specifically designed for psychologists and social scientists, offers its efficiency. Harmony specialises in simplifying the process of comparison or harmonisation. It uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to match items between different questionnaires. You can easily compare SDQ and SF-36. Harmony's AI models not only match each item but also give a percentage match. This feature goes a long way in reducing the subjectivity and human bias that can potentially derail the process. The software makes it easier than ever to understand how items in SDQ relate to those in SF-36, in a manner that is streamlined, objective, and incredibly time-efficient. The comparison of SDQ and SF-36 need not be a stressful process. Harmony is a proactive step towards enhancing comparison methods, making research more accurate and efficient. With the help of Harmony, you can shift your focus back to what truly matters - the findings and implications of your research. Start using Harmony today and explore the new standard in research and analysis for psychologists and social scientists.
